TopicTitle: your record for module manager patches,

Articles.Content:
I'm currently up to 5199 MM patches applied at the loading screen, whats your record?

![E2VM3Am](http://imgur.com/E2VM3Am)

2105 or so currently.

Big chunk has to be the thermometer mod that adds itself to every part.

I guess you are using DRE and FAR?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-13T14:11:58Z" title="05/13/2015 02:11  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 13, 2015</time> by KerbMav**
3306 at the moment......
At it's peak it was at 9000 on my RSS/RO install, needless to say, I got OOM errors every time I opened the game.
Mine is about 5700 with RSS/RO, but it crashed way too often. Now I've got about 170 because I removed most of my part mods (1.0 outdated most of them so I decided to drop them all together)

> 
> 2105 or so currently.
> Big chunk has to be the thermometer mod that adds itself to every part.
> 
> I guess you are using DRE and FAR?

Yeah, I think I have that thermometer mod you're talking about. And FAR but not DRE.

Howdi,

Good thread...I run 3800+ but I am loosing some more useless MODS - I am running about 1 hour gameplay before OOM crashes...I am trying to make room for clouds etc...I need to loose some 300 megs of game RAM still.

Cmdr Zeta

With .90 i had 14700 or so, but thats on a rock solid 64bit linux build. With 1.2 i have 2000, but thats cos b9 and LLL arent ready yet

Edit: just checked and im talking out of my a#@, mm files are at 11700. Still, id rather the below mentioned 27, maybe then ksp would load a minute or two quicker

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-13T19:18:04Z" title="05/13/2015 07:18  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 13, 2015</time> by Maars**

Record number of ModuleManager patches?

27

I rarely use anything which needs it.

> 
> Record number of ModuleManager patches?
> 27
> 
> I rarely use anything which needs it.

Haha, nice one ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
trying out the win 64 bit hack and I'm up to 23,149 right now.
500+ and counting. I'm downloading 6+ mods a week.
Somewhere over 10000 before I pruned my 0.90 RO install down to above 6000.

Wow. I've had hundreds and hundreds before, but since 1.0.2 I've kept the game as simple as possible. I was right around 123, but then I tried a new mod that changes the heat overlay colors and my patch count exploded up to around 450. I thought that was bad, and some of you have them in the 10's of thousands!!??!?
Curious why the OP cares about this. It's directly related to the mods you have...

> 
> 2105 or so currently.
> Big chunk has to be the thermometer mod that adds itself to every part.
> 
> I guess you are using DRE and FAR?

Which thermometer mod, the one which disables the stock heat one with the memory leak?

0.

I do not use ModuleManager or anything dependent on it ;P
My record is somewhere around 4000.

15470 at last load.

about 94 mods installed
Zero. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) What mods use modulemanager?
About 3k. What does MM do anyway?

I'm at 3408 patches right now ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif). IIRC my record was six thousand or so.

> 
> About 3k. What does MM do anyway?

Magic.

But seriously, [check the thread:](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219)

> 
> ModuleManager is mod that let you write patch file that edit other part at load time. With is you can edit squad (and other mod) part without overwriting their file.

Far from my record (which is 4 digits) today after adding in a few new mods, I loaded 666 patches. Is my KSP install going to summon the Hell Kraken, Satan, or what? What wrath of the universe have I just incurred?
Ummm 28715 patches... I think I broke something.
